text: Tap @ Himmeriget. Clear golden with small white head. Aroma is malt, grainy, hop, grass and hay. Flavour is malt, grass, hop, hay, little sweet, grainy and medium bitter.
On tap at a pub in Prague. Floral, grass, caramel, bread, good balance and drinkability.
Clear golden colour with White head.Aroma is fresh with taste of hops and grass crispy and malty with good well balancd nots of citrus and hops.
Drauggt. Golden coloured. Unclear. Dense off white head. Aroma. Butter herbs spice. Flavour. Herbssweetnes flowers. Medium bodied. Ends sweet and herbal.
Keg at himm de thingy ma bob Copenhagen 2017 ...Amber.. Thin white lacing... Grass hay nose.. Long dry hay herbal fruit
Tap @Himmeriget. Clear amber, thick white head. Grassy, malty aroma. Malty flavour, light hoppy bitterness. Smooth and dry.
Tap @ Himmeriget. Clear yellow with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty and moderate hoppy - grass. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and moderate bitter finish. 110517
Draught @ Dish Burger Bistro. Aroma is mild with sweetish hay and malt. Flavour has grassy hops, minerals, some mint, herbal nitrs and hints of malt. Clean, easy to drink and enjoyable.

On tap, @Restaurace Kulový Blesk, Praga. Viaje 03/2017
Color amarillo dorado, aromas cereal notas florales, sabor malta, notas lupuladas ligeras, cuerpo ligero.

Wow.

Draught in Prague and brought a few bottles back to Berlin.

Just great really. I ordered a second one immediately. Great mouthfeel, perfect amount of bitterness (a lot less bitterness than say Kout na umavě ) and nice grassy hops.

Hazy golden colour with a mediumsized white head. Aroma is nicely grassy, sweet malty and yeasty with some slight nutty edge to it. Flavour is yeasty, some grassy, herbal, sweet and bready malts to it as well. Ends somewhat bitter, along with a nice lingering yeastiness to it.
From tap. It pours mostly clear golden with a creamy white head. Grassy and malty aroma. Light herbal. Bitter hoppy and malty flavor with grassy notes. Tasty.

Light golden yellow with very little white head. Light malty aroma of bread and crackers. Cant sense the hops from this serving. Light sweetness in the taste and quite strong bitterness and some classic pilsner hop flavor in the taste. Really nice pilsner flavor and lots of it.

on tap at Prague Beer Museum. Golden color, high creamy white head. Aroma: fruity, yeasty, hoppy, malty. Taste: malt, fruit with light sour tones, noble hops. Medium body, moderate carbonation. Very nice pilsner

Tap @Himmeriget,Cph. Pours light hazy golden with a small, creamy white film head. Aroma has sweet malts, light citrus, mild grass. Medium carbonation, fine dry and quite creamy mouthfeel. Flavour has solid, light grainy malts, firm grassy hops. Lingering bitterness. Some citrus notes. Excellent.
Yellow color. Nice aroma with a hint of citrus. Great beer to have after a hot day.

Draught @ Himmeriget, Aaboulevard 27, DK-1960 Copenhagen N, Denmark. [ As Únětické Pivo 12° Nefiltrované ].Clear medium yellow orange color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, pale malt, bread notes, moderate to light heavy hoppy, grass, butterscotch notes. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and bitter with a long duration, fruity hops, fruity malt, pale malt, grass, earthy notes, bread notes, medium dry. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. [20160521]

Draught @ Himmeriget. Aroma of grain, earthy, saaz hops, grass, slight butterscotch. Taste of grain, light bitterness, perfect amount of earthy hops, slightly buttery. Awesome creamy mouthfeel and a great pils.

Draft @ Himmeriget, Copenhagen. Pours a slightly hazy yellow golden color with a small white head. Has a fruity malty grainy weak grassy aroma. Fruity malty grainy grassy hoppy bitter flavor. Has a fruity malty grassy hoppy finish.
[5/10/16] Draught at Himmeriget in Copenhagen. Clear golden. Aroma of lager yeast, grassy hops, grains. Flavor has sweetish bready malt, graininess, and bitter grassy hops. Quite light-bodied. Nice.
Tap himmeriget. Pours light hazy golden with a white head. Aroma of malts, grain, touch of herbal, light citrus, light bready. Taste is light herbal, light bread, with a touch of citrusy hops.
Tap @ Himmeriget. Pours a light hazy golden with a small white head. Grassy, citrussy, hay, bready, pale malty. Crisp.

Draught @Himmeriget . 
Poured golden in color with a thin white head. 
Grainy malty, earthy, bready, slightly buttery aroma.
Buttery, grainy malty with some grassy hops. Minerally finish. Great pilsner.
Praha 2016 @ valahol az éjszakába. Szűretlen forma. -bontás. Éleszt az -ő. Sallang. -mentes.

Draught at the brewery. Nice off white head 
Solid golden color that is light opaque . Big flower hope aroma. Big Nobel hope taste with complementing malt. Firm bitterness and well fermented

Draught at Himmeriget.
Clear golden colored with a small white head.
Malty aroma of hay and hops with notes of grass.
Malty flavor of hops and grass with notes of hay.
Hoppy finish.
From tap at Himmeriget. Hazy golden colour with a white head. Aroma and flavour of malt, hops, straw and bitterness.

Look; off white head, near clear golden body, thick lacing.
Aroma; caramel, malts, dusty hops, bread, fruits.
Taste; grass, malts, caramel, honey notes, meadow spices, wort, bread, butter, and hops come rising up in the finish. 
Palate; smooth, easy, fully, wellbodied. 
Overall; quality 12 thats for sure! Good!
Tasted at U Jama.
From tap. Pours cloudy orange with a small white head. Aroma is grassy and slight eggy. Slight sweet. Toasted, light grassy. Bitter and toasted finish.

Light fruity and grassy hoppy aroma and taste, some bready pale malt, light citrus lemon, straw, hay, some delicate floral nuances throughout, crisp and light on the palate, very tasty.

#470Bottle 0.7l from brewery. Almost clear golden body, medium white head. Aroma of malts, yeast, hops, grains, honey. Taste is sweetish bitter. The same as nose with bread crust. Medium body and carbonation. An archetypal craft pilsener.

Bottle 0.75l from the brewery. Slightly cloudy, gold colored. AROMA- malt, yeast, bread, touch of hops. FLAVOR- slightly sweet, pleasantly bitter, malty, bready, yeasty. Medium bodied.Very good lager.

From tap at Nota Bene, Prague. Unclear yellow golden color with off white head. Malty and light hoppy aroma, grainy, bread, caramel, light grass, honey. Sweet and bitter taste like aroma. Light to medium oily body with soft carbonation.
Golden color with white head. Hoppy but higher in sweetness. Good lager, could be more bitter.

Light lager, the one at the beer museum, the unfiltered one probably as everyone else has said, its forgettable with a slightly bitter finish.... what, are you trying to buy this beer to go with a specific food? Like wine? Seriously, this ones hard to pick out of a crowd. I tried it once and I bet you that if you lined up all these Czech lagers tomorrow I couldnt pick it out. Like a blind taste test. Sounds tempting. Let me know where to show up.
Tap at Pivni Klub 300. Rather clear, nice grassy, citrus, crackers. Herbal, vegetal, grass, leafs. Fuller body, very herbal, light malts. Little too much carbonation maybe.

UPDATED: DEC 14, 2015 Čapované v Lokal Pube Nitra. Kalná zlatavá farba, biela pena, nevýrazná aróma. Plná horká chuť, dobrý leiak. Dodatok,: Beer Time Nitra - vyia rezkosť, jemná aróma chmelu, skvelá vyváená chuť, super!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
On tap at Nota bene, Prague. Hazy golden with small white to off white head. Malts, honey, brown sugar and flowers. Malty throughout. Medium body, soft carbonation. Tasty, but maybe to light.

Draught @ Nota Bene, Prague. Pours cloudy dark straw with very stable white head. Clear aroma of yeast and malt, with some hoppy and grainy notes. Sweetish, malty and estery flavour with bitter, hoppy notes. Hints of citrus. Bitter and estery aftertaste. Creamy mouthfeel. Mild but well-balanced and very enjoyable.
Draught at the brewpub on May 21, 2015.Hazy golden color, smallish off-white head. Malty, some butterscotch, herbal taste. Medium mouthfeel, medium bitterness. Herbal aftertaste. Herbal scent.

Keg at Beer Museum in Prague Day 5 of Fergus and Sarahs Czech jaunt. 3/10/14. Hazed golden / yellow coloured pour with a steadfast creamy white head. Aroma is yeasty, earthy straw, pils grains, subdued on the nose. Flavour is composed of earthy grains, straw, semi-sweet, nutty grains. Palate is creamy, medium body, lowish carbonation. Nice unfiltered nothing special.

Draught at Nota Bene, Prague. Clear golden beer with a nice lasting offwhite head. Malty bready aroma, slightly spicy, grass, Saaz-hops, hay, geapefruit notes. Hoppy grassy flavor, bready, hay, citrus, pepper, some floral notes. Quite refreshing.
Draught @ Pivovarsky Klub (unfiltered). Pours golden with a white head. A beer dominated by a flowery hop profile. Refreshingly bitter. Well balanced.

On tap at Prague Beer Museum. After one friendly waitress got us a couple of beers, another, quite less so, took the order for a sampler and then didnt bother to tell us what was what. Luckily, it wasnt hard to guess. Anyway, this poured a murky shinier yellow body. Sharp perfumey creamy aroma, herbal, and not in a very good way. Sweetish polleny lager, with notes of wet cardboard, ending dry. Just a shade less bitter than expected, but theres a passable herbal hoppy note. Well... hm. I like it and I didnt. Maybe it wasnt in the best of shapes - it was interesting, with some pros, but some cons that make some of these high grades look weird. Oh well. Bit sad I have to go against the grain here, but I really do.

On tap, OP, 31czk/0.3l. Hazy pale body with high creamy head. Aroma is clean malty, light yeasty. Taste has high earthy bitterness, malty medium sweetness, well balanced. High carbonation, medium body.

(tap 0,5l @ OP (Brno))
Aroma : Yeasty, light sweet, very light hops.
Appearance : Hazy, light golden color. Medium white head.
Taste : Medium sweet, medium bitter, yeasty.
Palate : Medium body. Long hoppy bitter finish.
Overall : Tasty, nice finish.
Tap , U Slovanske Lipy , Prague , CZ , Malt,bread,butter,grassy and herbal aroma , Hazy golden color with bigger lacing head , Sweeter taste with nice bitter finish , Medium body , Very pleasant.

Draught
Aroma-grass, 
Appearance-pale, hazy, white foam, 
Taste-light sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, 
Palate-light body, sticky, average carbonation, bitter finish
Overall-perfect

On tap @ Kulovy Blesk, Prague. Hazy light yellow body, medium white head. Aroma is honey, pale malts, straw, hints of grains. A bit bland, but nice enough. Taste is pale malts, straw, hints of dusty grass and biscuits. A bit bland. Slightly watery body, medium carbonation. Fair enough for a lager, but not even close to mid-range in general.

Vycap Richtar Jakub. Tmavo zlata farba s peknou kremovou bielou penou. Vona sladova, na konci citit chmele. V chuti opat sladovost, ktora postupne prechadza do horkosti. Velmi lahke telo. Pivo ma nepresvedcilo.
On tap. Pours golden color, white head. Aroma is malty and bit hoppy. Taste is medium bitter, malty, bit hoppy.
Tak tohle bylo dobre pivo. Vyrazna horka zemita chut, pekna trvala pena. Plastak bartrem za kance.

On tap, restaurant V polích. In my view the most outstanding Czech pilsner at the moment. Rich, lingering bitter strong aroma of hops combined with citruses and perhaps also a hint of coriander. Somehow strangely resembles a good balanced IPA at times. Recommended!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Très bonne pilsner de Pragues!!! :)
Elle a vraiment du gout!!! :).....................

Plastic bottle from the brewery. Pours mostly clear golden with quickly disappearing white head. Aroma is lots of hops, grass, pine with a hint of yeast and marihuana (seriously). Flavor is hops, grass, malt, hint of pine and yeast. Pleasant hops aftertaste.

on tap at assorted beer festivals, prague pubs and klub malych pivovaru in pilsen. an excellent, reliable rendition of the style - always a rich golden with a vibrant head; fresh grassy hop character; buttery texture and plenty of bitterness. just about perfect

From tap at Kulovy blesk Praha. Pours slightly hazy pale yellow with firm white head. Aroma is malty, grass, dough, bread. Taste is medium sweet and bitter, malty, cereals. Very good balanced beer. Highly drinkable.

Goldiges Bier mit minimaler Trübung und feinem Schaum. Blumiges Malzaroma mit grasigem Hopfen. Süß-bitterer, crisper Geschmack mit aromatischem Hopfen; die Ausgewogenheit sucht ihresgleichen. Ultra-süffiges Pivo!

Nice as a subtle start towards and ipa. Has some hops and nice bitterness some metallic taste which is not favored by me. Nice pilsner overall

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tapped. Rich aroma - there are some place even for some fruits and citrus. The hops in the beers body as well, although not so agressive. Some caramels and bread here as well. One of the best beer in that beer style.

From tap at Nota Bene in Prague. Dark golden, unclear with large white head. Not much aroma, but.that could be blamed on the glass. Low carbonation. Wonderful, hoppy taste. An absolutely superb pilsner.
Classic Pilsner look. Aroma of apricots, bread. Taste is light sweet, medium bitter. Nice and refreshing. Light body, slick texture, average carbonation. One of my favorite Pilsners.
Draft. A golden beer with a white head. The aroma has notes of hops, straw, and malt. The flavor is sweet with notes of straw, malr, and caramel, leading to a bitter finish.

ivory white thick creamy head disappears with structured lacing. straw-yellow slight turbid colour. aroma of sulphur, malt, hop, cheesy, slight esters/yeast. taste is very hoppy, with bitter aftertaste. dry mouthfeel, medium body and carbonation. tastes a bit skunky after a while, pitty. 30 cl draft @ Nota Bene/Praha

UPDATED: AUG 14, 2013 Zly Casy.0.5 draught. Big head, lacing. Golden colour. Aroma: rasberries. Flavour: rasberry, lime, spicy light body, light sweetness. Overall: intresting hops full of rasberries ( think, name of hop is sladek). But I?m not big fan of rasberries

En fût. Pinte dégustée chez Nota Bene (Prague, République-Tchèque). Arôme: Odeur de céréale avec une pointe dhoublon. Apparence: La couleur est blonde légèrement voilée. Présence dun moyen col mousseux et dune large dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût de céréale avec une pointe dagrume. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement onctueuse. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Légère présence de céréales en arrière goût. (Rating #4896)
draught at Kulovy Blesk. Hazy golden yellow, creamy white head. Malty with lots of saaz hops, bitter-sweet overall character. Delicious and very, very moreish.

Tap at Hostinec Richtar Jakub. Aroma yeasty, pilsenery, malty, very light hops. Lightly hazy yellow to golden colour. Taste pilsener malt, yeasty, light hoppiness. Finish is pleasant, malty sweet with light hops sting. Good one, not exceptional though.
Golden color with medium white head. Aroma of malt, bitter hops, yeast. Taste, malt, yeast, Saaz hops. Hoppy finish.

1 L plastic bottle shared by MartinT. Bottle was a few weeks old.
Appearance : Slightly hazy blond with a big fluffy head thanks to a hard pour. Long head retention, nice lacing.

Aroma : Rich bready and slightly toasted malts. Some earthy hops with floral and citrusy notes. Some wet earthy notes.

Taste : Great malty-bready notes. Earthy and citrusy hops. Moderate bitterness. Finish is malty, with notes of slightly burnt bread crust. Earthy and citrusy. Rich and rustic. 

Palate : Soft and pillowy carbonation. 

Overall : Im so glad that Martin was able to share this with me. Really interesting stuff. Amazing to see how such a simple malt and hop bill can draw your attention and be so expressive and substantial. Really nice rich rustic malt. Great malty persistence. An amazing example of the style and an awesome drink. Truly an experience.

Keg. Pours a gorgeous hazy Gold with a dense White head. Aroma is Fresh cut grass and a touch of yeast. The flavour is bready yeast with more Saaz grass popping on your tongue. The bitterness is intense for a Pilsner. This is a real joy to behold. Unteice and Kout have really perfected the Pilsner process.

My Bottom Line:
Baguette crusts, rustic, hay-like malts and hop spiciness coalesce in this bitter, herbal Svetly.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A pillowy head of foam sits still atop the misty golden.
-The mouthfeel is predictably (and deliciously) frothy, fluffy, comfortable.
-Hops possess a subtly citrusy, herbal and peppery personality that is quite engaging in the second half.
-Flavor profile is balanced, but the hop bitterness takes over in the finish.
-This is a beautiful baguette of a Svetly. You can even imagine a lightly tart fruitiness within the crust which vanishes instantly when it touches the center of the baguette.
-The more I drink this beer, the more I want. Next time Im going to Czechia, Im bringing back more than these 2 1.5-liter bottles..

On tap at Nota Bene, Praha and from PET bottles.

On tap at two or three occasions, this rating for the first time on tap at Nota Bene beerpoint (01/03/13). Nefiltrovany. Hazy gold pour with thick creamy white head. Beautiful grain aroma, spicy, citrusy, almost buttery but not diacetyl, more a yeasty aroma. Taste is grainy, on the grainy side, only light hop flavor, honey-like perceived sweetness, fluffy and silky on the palate. A small gem, but not as wonderful as the filtered 10°.
On tap at klub malych pivovaru in Plzen.Pours hazy honey gold.Aroma of Fruity hops,caramel and gummy bears.Flavor of mint,leather,sweet malt,dough,yeast,rose pedals and buttery nuts.
Jedna z nejpitelnějích českých dvanáctek. Hořký začátek, poté je mírně cítit slad a nakonec opět pořádná chmelová dochuť.

(Draught at Kulovy Blesk, Prague, 26 July 2012) Hazy golden colour with creamy, off-white head. Malty nose with notes of bread, grass, toffee and herbal hops. Malty taste with grass, bread, hay, a touch of honey and gentle herbal bitterness in the finish. Medium body, with a certain malt sweetness. Tasty, solid and nice.

UPDATED: SEP 14, 2016 Cloudy golden with a lasting white head. Bready malt aroma with a touch of herbal hops. Sweetish bready malt flavour, almost with a toffee note, with grassy and herbal hops and a good bitter finish

Tap @ Note Bene, Prague. Pours slightly hazy yellow with a white head. Aroma of malt, bread, fresh grassy and flowery hops.  Flavor is malt, bready, grass, flowery, light citrus. Medium body, soft carbonation, nice bitter finish. 060812

(on tap, unfiltered) brass-coloured, very hazy, with a white head. Smells of dried grains, bread-like. Aroma of malted grains with a herbal note. Taste is rather bitter. Very bitter finish. Well-crafted and well-drinkable.
Clasic pilsen style with light haze, strong taste, bright yellow colour, thick white head.
Tap @ Kulovy Blesk, Prague. Pours cloudy golden with a small white head and lacings. Grass, mild citrus, hay and fresh baked bread. Crisp and dry. Lovely!

UPDATED: AUG 18, 2014 From draft at Kulovy Blesk.  Nefiltrovany.  Lightly hazed gold body with perfect looking and long-lasting fluffy white head. Superbly crisp, grassy, hoppy and pungent. Lemon, honey, crackers, light doughy yeast, all in perfect balance, and overall it leans to the dry side, and the light body (resembling more a 10° or 11°) is unreal. Snappy, crisp, zesty and superbly clean with incredible smoothness. Beautiful hop bouquet.

On tap at U Tomase Stitneho, Prague. Pours cloudy hazy golden with a big creamy white head. Aroma of grassy  and fruity hops. Taste is full of citrussy hops, moderate sweet caramel, lingering all the way to the end. Very good and moreish.

On tap at the brewery in Únětíce: Golden, hazy, creamy stable off-white head; moderate aromatic (Saaz) hoppy nose with some pale malt underneath; moderate bitter-sweet flavour, creamy MF, light to medium bodied; lingering Saaz finish, sticking to the palate. Well crafted, archetypal bohemian Pilsener......

bottle and draught , nice grasy floral meadow aroma, pale, hazy, white foam, frothy, medium bitterness, medium sweetness, classic czech taste nice sweatness with medium bitterness, medium body, slick feel, thick feel, average carbonation, bitter, long finish, full mouth beer, nice
user_location: Cambridge and Kladno(Czech Rep.), Cambridgeshire, ENGLAND

text: (draught) pours a hazy yellow colour with a frothy white head. aroma of delicate floral hops, powdered sugar, wheat and light barnyard. flavour is almost like a witbier, very sugary, with a lot of cactus juice and perfume. medium-bodied with average carbonation.
